title:
Include all POI categories in search

Refactor POISearchManager to include all available MKPointOfInterestCategory types.

Currently hardcoded to a specific subset of categories. This limits discovery of relevant POIs.

Should:
- Expand filter to include all categories (or at least most common ones)
- Remove restrictive category filtering
- Improve search results quality
- Prepare for user-configurable filtering in future ticket

System integrations: Widgets, Control Center, Siri

Add integration with iOS system features for quick access to POI logging.
- Home screen widget for quick capture
- Lock screen widget (iOS 16+)
- Control Center toggle/action
- Siri shortcut for logging POI
- Each integration should launch capture flow

Show current location on map

In ContentView, add a map displaying the user's current location (in addition to coordinates).
- Center map on user's current location
- Show location pin/marker
- Allow basic map interaction (pan, zoom)
- Display address or location name if available
- Map should update as location changes

UI Enhancements Epic

Improve the user experience and visual polish of the POI Logger app.

Related improvements:
- Map view integration in log entries
- Enhanced location capture interaction
- User-configurable search parameters
- Better date/time formatting in YAML

Add configurable search radius

Allow users to customize the search radius for nearby POIs.
- Currently hardcoded to 0.5 miles (804.67m)
- Add settings or UI control to let user set radius in miles
- Update search when radius changes
- Persist user preference

Fix Capture Location button tap area

The button's tap target doesn't match the visible button size.
- Ensure tap area covers entire visible button
- Test on various screen sizes
- Verify accessibility hit area is sufficient (minimum 44x44pt)

Change date format to separate date and time

Currently using ISO8601 format (2025-12-27T22:50:35Z).
Should be split into:
- date: 2025-12-27
- time: 22:50

This improves readability in the YAML output for Obsidian integration.

Add check-in history log

Create a persistent log of all POI check-ins with chronological list view.

Features:
- Save each POI capture to local database
- Display chronological list (newest first)
- Show date, time, POI name, distance from current location
- Map view showing all logged locations
- Search/filter by date range or location name
- Export to plaintext (CSV, JSON, or markdown)
- Delete individual entries
- Statistics (total check-ins, most visited places, etc.)
Add 'Open in Maps' affordance in YAML preview
Add user setting to toggle POI category labels
description: Allow users to show/hide the POI category labels in the nearby places list. Currently showing all categories from .includingAll results in many unfamiliar business types - users may want to hide category labels for a cleaner view.

title: Fix YAMLPreviewView showing wrong data on first open
description: When first tapping a POI in POIListView, the YAMLPreviewView shows 'Unknown Location' and blank address. Subsequent opens work correctly. Root cause: race condition between setting selectedPOI and showYAMLPreview state variables. Solution: use .sheet(item:) instead of .sheet(isPresented:) to ensure POI data is bound correctly.

title:
Fix app stuck at last check-in location on reopen

When reopening the app, it sometimes gets stuck showing the previous location data instead of fetching fresh coordinates.

Need to:
- Force refresh location on app launch
- Add ability for user to manually refresh/re-request location
- Clear cached location state when appropriate
- Add a 'Refresh' button to ContentView

Data Persistence & History Epic

Implement local storage and historical tracking of POI check-ins.

Enables users to:
- Build a personal log of visited places over time
- Export and analyze their location history
- View patterns and statistics about their movements
- Access check-in data across app sessions

Add map view to log entry

In the YAMLPreviewView, beneath the Copy YAML and Share buttons, display a map showing the location of the captured POI.
- Show the POI location with a pin
- Allow user to interact with the map (pan, zoom)
- Display coordinates on the map

Add user-configurable POI category filtering

Allow users to select which POI categories they want to search for.

Features:
- Settings screen to manage POI category preferences
- Checkboxes for each category (restaurant, cafe, shopping, etc.)
- Default all categories checked
- Persist user preferences
- Update search when preferences change
- Show selected categories in UI

This builds on the expanded POI categories from previous ticket.

System Integration Epic

Add iOS system-level features for quick POI logging access.

Integrations:
- Home screen widgets for one-tap capture
- Lock screen quick actions
- Control Center toggle
- Siri voice commands
- Seamless app launching from system features
